alert.note: Alert for Petroleum; Southwest Phillips (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 04 at 2:10PM MST until January 06 at 3:00PM MST by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MST THURSDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, blowing snow. Widespread blowing snow will reduce visibilities to as low as a quarter of a mile. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Montana. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 PM MST this afternoon. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 3 PM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
